ECClass.description: a valve that can be used to modify (regulate) the fluid flow rate in a process control system. it usually includes an actuator, which responds to a signal from the controlling system and changes the position of the flow controlling element in the valve.

a control valve that is an angle valve with a corresponding actuator intended to manipulate a stream of fluid in response to a difference between a signal from an external sensing element and a setpoint and with input of energy from an external source.
a valve that has valve ports which are not in-line.

a globe valve that deviates from the in-line design, i.e. with a body shape designed to adjust the flow direction with a specified angle relative to the straight through-flow an in-line valve would have provided for.

a check valve that deviates from the in-line design, i.e. with a body shape designed to adjust the flow direction with a specified angle relative to the straight through-flow an in-line valve would have provided for.

a check globe valve that deviates from the in-line design, i.e. with a body shape designed to adjust the flow direction with a specified angle relative to the straight through-flow an in-line valve would have provided for.

a globe valve that deviates from the in-line design, i.e. with a body shape designed to adjust the flow direction with a specified angle relative to the straight through-flow an in-line valve would have provided for.

a plug valve that deviates from the in-line design, i.e. with a body shape designed to adjust the flow direction with a specified angle relative to the straight through-flow an in-line valve would have provided for.
a valve that includes a means of operation (e.g. spring / gravity / fluid pressure / counter balance), and is not depending on an external source of energy.
a self operating valve that is set to open at a certain pressure level to prevent the pressure in a container or system from reaching unsafe levels.

Used for annotating reducers according to the orientation of the reducer within a Pipeline

ECClass.description: An Abstract super type for Objects used and referenced in a document that do not represnt a physical asset

ECRelationshipClass.description: A <containment_of_individual> is a <relative_location> where the located <possible_individual> is contained by the locator <possible_individual> but is not part of it.

A <composition_of_individual> is a <relationship> that indicates that the part <possible_individual> is a part of the whole <possible_individual>. A simple composition is indicated, unless a subtype is instantiated too.
An <arrangement_of_individual> is a <composition_of_individual> that indicates that the part is a part of an <arranged_individual>. The temporal extent of the part is that of the whole.

An <assembly_of_individual> is an <arrangement_of_individual> that indicates that the part is connected directly or indirectly to other parts of the whole. The parts and wholes are super-molecular objects.

ECClass.description: A fluid container which is operating under atmospheric pressure.
A recepatacle, container or part of a structure designed and manufactured to keep solids or liquids.
a recepatacle, container or part of a structure designed and manufactured to keep solids or liquids.
A vessel intended to be in open connection to atmosphere.
A device located in a flowstream measuring the flow.
A physical object that detects an aspect of something; records, modifies and/or displays such an aspect or performs a combination of these activities.
A process instrument that is intended to measure a physical quantity (IEV, IEC-770-1) and to indicate and/or to transmit a signal which represents a measured variable.
A detecting instrument intended to measure and indicate flow rate and/or produce a signal which represents the measured flow rate.

A flow meter with a restriction placed in the flow line causes the velocity of the flowing fluid to change. The change of flow velocities causes changes in pressures between two measurement points which then is used to calculate the flow velocity.
A differential pressure flow meter utilizing a pitot tube (a probe with an open tip) that is inserted into the flow field.
A pitot tube flow meter that uses an pitot tube with multiple openings.
A blower in which the flow direction is parallel to the shaft.
A recepatacle, container or part of a structure designed and manufactured to keep solids or liquids.
A filter with non-rigid containers with an opening at one side, usually equipped with a mechanism for easy cleaning by beating.
A filter where gas is passed through cloth bags to remove dust

a control valve that is an inline valve with a corresponding actuator intended to manipulate a stream of fluid in response to a difference between a signal from an external sensing element and a setpoint and with input of energy from an external source.
A ball valve that is equipped with an actuator that manipulates a stream of fluid in the response to a signal from an external sensing element and with input of energy from an external source.
A physical object for grinding or pulverizing materials. Also a machine for shaping metal. In general a machine that manufactures by the continuous repetition of some simple action
A tumbling mill consisting of a horizontal cylindrical vessel in which a given material is ground by rotation with balls typically made of steel or ceramic.

force perpendicular to the area divided by area. p = df/da where df is the perpendicular component of the force acting on the area element da. the pressure is positive when the force is acting into the area.

the degree or intensity of heat or cold as measured on a thermometric scale, and a measure of whether two systems are relatively hot or cold with respect to one another. two systems brought into contact will, after sufficient time, be in thermal equilibrium and will have the same temperature.
tau xz= eta (delta(vx)/delta(z)) where tau xz is the shear stress (shear force pr. unit area)in a fluid moving with a velocity gradient dvx/dz perpendicular to the plane of shear.

ECProperty.description: the closeness of agreement between the result of a measurement and the (conventional) true value of the quantity being measured.
the highest value of the measured variable to which a device is actually adjusted to measure within a specified accuracy
the values, in steady state, of an output variable of a system or device as a function of an input variable.
the lowest value of the measured variable to which a device can be adjusted to measure within a specified accuracy
the region of the values between the lower and upper limits of the quantity under consideration

ECClass.description: A electronic circuit that is a communication device that multiplexes (combines) several signals for transmission over a single medium. A demultiplexor completes the process by separating multiplexed signals from a transmission line. Frequently a multiplexor and demultiplexor are combined into a signal device capable of processing both outgoing and incoming signals.
A needle valve that is equipped with an actuator that manipulates a stream of fluid in the response to a signal from an external sensing element and with input of energy from an external source.

a globe valve that has a closure member with the shape of a conical plug (needle) which closes into a small seat. typically used for flow metering or damping of pressure fluctuations on instruments, e.g. pressure gauge.

ECClass.description: an artefact consisting of two disc with equal thickness and outer diameter connected with a flat bar. one of the discs is furnished with a hole thus allowing fluid flow, and the other blocing the flow. the first is installed during normal operation, the latter when blocking is required.

A stop check valve that is equipped with an actuator that manipulates a stream of fluid in the response to a signal from an external sensing element and with input of energy from an external source.
a lift check valve that is combining the self-acting operation of a check valve with the manual action of a globe valve.

a check valve that is a check valve where the closure member is a disc which swings freely on a hinge and which opens automatically when flow is established and closes automatically when flow ceases or is reversed.

A velocity flow meter that measures the velocity of a flow by measuring the time difference between an ultrasonic pulse sent in the flow direction and an ultrasound pulse sent opposite the flow direction.
An artefact which is appllied to draw gas from an enclosure to create vacuum.
